TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HealthServiceConnection extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Simplifies access to the HealthVault service. This class is abstract.
Docs.remarks:
A connection must be made to the HealthVault service to access the web methods that the service exposes. The class does not maintain an open connection to the service. It uses XML over HTTP to make requests and receive responses from the service. The connection just maintains the data necessary to make the request.
You cannot directly instantiate this abstract class. Instead, instantiate an instance of or to communicate with the Microsoft HealthVault service.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ApplicationId As Guid
Public ReadOnly Property AuthenticationToken As String

Docs.summary: Gets the authorization token to be used in all requests for this user.
Docs.value: A base64 encoded string that represents the person ID, application ID, expiration, and group membership of the person and application requesting access to HealthVault.
Docs.remarks: The authorization token can be retrieved using the web method from HealthVault or by calling the HealthVault Shell authentication web page.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.CancelAllRequests : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Cancels any pending request to HealthVault that was initiated with this connection instance and prevents any new requests from being made.
Docs.remarks:
Setting this property to true will cancel any requests that was started using this connection and will prevent new requests from being made. It is up to the caller to start the request on another thread. Cancelling will cause a HealthServiceRequestCancelledException to be thrown on the thread the request was executed on.
If you want to start reusing the connection set the property to false.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceRequest CreateRequest (string methodName, int methodVersion);

Public Overridable Function CreateRequest (methodName As String, methodVersion As Integer) As HealthServiceRequest
abstract member CreateRequest : string * int -> Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceRequest override this.CreateRequest : string * int -> Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceRequest

Docs.param: The name of the method of the web-service to call.
The version of the method to call.
Docs.summary: Provides a wrapper around the XML request for the web service.
Docs.returns: A that acts as a wrapper to XML request for the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This method skips the object model provided by the other methods of this class and acts as a simple wrapper around the XML request for the web service. The caller must provide the parameters in the correct format for the called method and in order to parse the response data.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the application credential that is used to access HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Culture : System.Globalization.CultureInfo with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the language to be sent to the server when making requests.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo GetServiceDefinition() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets information about the HealthVault service.
Docs.returns: A instance that contains the service version, SDK assemblies versions and URLs, method information, and so on.
Docs.remarks:
Gets the latest information about the HealthVault service. This includes:
- The version of the service.
- The SDK assembly URLs.
- The SDK assembly versions.
- The SDK documentation URL.
- The URL to the HealthVault Shell.
- The schema definition for the HealthVault method's request and response.
- The common schema definitions for types that the HealthVault methods use.
- Information about all available HealthVault instances.
Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error.
One or more URL strings returned by HealthVault is invalid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo GetServiceDefinition(valuetype Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfoSections responseSections) cil managed
Public Function GetServiceDefinition (responseSections As ServiceInfoSections) As ServiceInfo

Docs.param: The categories of information to be populated in the instance, represented as the result of XOR'ing the desired categories.
Docs.summary: Gets information about the HealthVault service corresponding to the specified categories.
Docs.returns: A instance that contains some or all of the service version, SDK assemblies versions and URLs, method information, and so on, depending on which information categories were specified.
Docs.remarks:
Gets the latest information about the HealthVault service. Depending on the specified , this will include some or all of:
- The version of the service.
- The SDK assembly URLs.
- The SDK assembly versions.
- The SDK documentation URL.
- The URL to the HealthVault Shell.
- The schema definition for the HealthVault method's request and response.
- The common schema definitions for types that the HealthVault methods use.
- Information about all available HealthVault instances.
Retrieving only the sections you need will give a faster response time than downloading the full response.
Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error.
One or more URL strings returned by HealthVault is invalid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo GetServiceDefinition(valuetype System.DateTime lastUpdatedTime) cil managed
Public Function GetServiceDefinition (lastUpdatedTime As DateTime) As ServiceInfo

Docs.param: The time of the last update to an existing cached copy of .
Docs.summary: Gets information about the HealthVault service only if it has been updated since the specified update time.
Docs.returns: If there were updates to the service information since the specified , a instance that contains the service version, SDK assemblies versions and URLs, method information, and so on. Otherwise, if there were no updates, returns null.
Docs.remarks:
Gets the latest information about the HealthVault service, if there were updates since the specified . If there were no updates the method returns null. This includes:
- The version of the service.
- The SDK assembly URLs.
- The SDK assembly versions.
- The SDK documentation URL.
- The URL to the HealthVault Shell.
- The schema definition for the HealthVault method's request and response.
- The common schema definitions for types that the HealthVault methods use.
- Information about all available HealthVault instances.
Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error.
One or more URL strings returned by HealthVault is invalid.

Docs.param: The categories of information to be populated in the instance, represented as the result of XOR'ing the desired categories.

Docs.summary: Gets information about the HealthVault service corresponding to the specified categories if the requested information has been updated since the specified update time.
Docs.returns: If there were updates to the service information since the specified , a instance that contains some or all of the service version, SDK assemblies versions and URLs, method information, and so on, depending on which information categories were specified. Otherwise, if there were no updates, returns null.
Docs.remarks:
Gets the latest information about the HealthVault service, if there were updates since the specified . If there were no updates the method returns null. Depending on the specified , this will include some or all of:
- The version of the service.
- The SDK assembly URLs.
- The SDK assembly versions.
- The SDK documentation URL.
- The URL to the HealthVault Shell.
- The schema definition for the HealthVault method's request and response.
- The common schema definitions for types that the HealthVault methods use.
- Information about all available HealthVault instances.
Retrieving only the sections you need will give a faster response time than downloading the full response.
Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error.
One or more URL strings returned by HealthVault is invalid.
